dmca.title: Conpyright Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Community Foundation for Oak Park
[mailto:info@OakParkFoundation.org] 
Posted At: Tuesday, November 28, 2006 4:21 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: Conpyright Infringement
Subject: Conpyright Infringement


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

It has come to our attention that the World Hongming Foundation, a
customer of yours, has made an unauthorized use of our copyrighted works
(our Works) as itemized below.  We have reserved all rights in our
Works, all three of which were first published on the Web with copyright
notices not later than 1999.  Your customer's works use content
essentially identical to the content of our Works and clearly used our
Works as their bases.

Your customer's page at
<http://www.hongming.us/foundation/Category-of-Donations.htm> copies
much of our page at <http://www.oakparkfoundation.org/donations.html>.

Your customer's page at
<http://www.hongming.us/foundation/Donor-Defined-Funds.htm> copies much
of our page at <http://www.oakparkfoundation.org/funds.html>.

Your customer's page at
<http://www.hongming.us/foundation/en-Tax-Exempt.htm> copies much of our
page at <http://www.oakparkfoundation.org/taxexempt.html>.

As your customer neither asked for nor received permission to use our
Works as the bases for your customer's works nor to make or distribute
copies -- including electronic copies -- of same, I believe your
customer has willfully infringed our rights under 17 U.S.C. Section 101
et seq. and could be liable for statutory damages as high as $150,000 as
set forth in Section 504(c)(2) therein.

As the registered owner of the IP address 69.56.147.162 associated with
the <www.hongming.us> domain, you have the authority to control the
contents of all Web pages at that domain.  That authority imposes upon
you the responsibility for ensuring that all such contents are in
compliance with the law, no matter who actually provided the contents of
those Web pages or composed the HTML for them.

We request that you immediately prevent the distribution all infringing
works derived from our Works.  That means you must delete all content
from your Web server that infringes upon our copyright.
We further request that you erase all electronically archived copies of
same that exist on the Internet or on local computers or recording
media.

We have attempted to contact the World Hongming Foundation regarding
this issue.  However, no response has been received to postal mail to
the Administrative Contact of the domain owner (to the address shown by
a WhoIs query) sent more than a month ago.

I declare under penalty of perjury that the above information is
accurate, that the Community Foundation for Oak Park (a corporation) is
the owner of the infringed work, and that I have been elected President
of the Community Foundation for Oak Park by the Board of Trustees
thereof and am thus the official spokesperson for that organization.  I
wish to point out that I have evidence through a third party that our
Work existed on the World Wide Web with our copyright notice at least
six years ago.

- --

David Ross, President
Community Foundation for Oak Park
P. O. Box 291
Agoura, CA 91376-0291
818/889-7078

- --------

Supporting our community with volunteers and grants since 1979.  
See the Community Foundation on the Web at
<http://www.OakParkFoundation.org/>

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: PGP 8.0.3                                               

iQA/AwUBRWy2RINxG4rj7+GnEQIQfACcCSowryYqltOy6WKWKcwoYNg53Z0Ani5G

=jTMk
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----


David E. Ross

The message above has been digitally signed with my DSS/DH key.  My keys
are available on public key servers and at 
<http://www.rossde.com/PGP/mykeys.html>.
